Title:
Hidden diversity of stipitate Phylloporia (Hymenochaetaceae,
Agaricomycetes) species in the subxerophitic ecosystems of the
Argentinean Chaco
Keywords:
morphological delimitation, neotropical polypores,
phylogeny, South America, taxonomy.
Abstract:
Coltricia stuckertiana is an emblematic stipitate species
from the Chaquean ecosystems of North and Center Argentina, which in
previous phylogenetic studies was indicated to be a polyphyletic species
outside of Coltricia. To solve the taxonomic status of C. stuckertiana,
a phylogenetic reconstruction was made based on the D1-D2 domains of the
28S gene (LSU) combined with the internal transcribed spacer region
(ITS) and elongation factor 1-alpha (EF 1-Î±), together with the
morphologic revision of the lectotype and reference materials. Our
results showed three independent, not closely related species within
Phylloporia. Consequently, C. stuckertiana is transferred to Phylloporia
and two new cryptic South American species, P. lutiana and P.
spegazziniana, are described hereafter.
